Lidar ransac planes

Source: R/lidar_analysis.R
wbt_lidar_ransac_planes.Rd

Performs a RANSAC analysis to identify points within a LiDAR point cloud that belong to linear planes.

wbt_lidar_ransac_planes(
  input,
  output,
  radius = 2,
  num_iter = 50,
  num_samples = 5,
  threshold = 0.35,
  model_size = 8,
  max_slope = 80,
  classify = FALSE,
  last_returns = FALSE,
  wd = NULL,
  verbose_mode = FALSE,
  compress_rasters = FALSE
)

Arguments

input

Input LiDAR file.
output

Output LiDAR file.
radius

Search Radius.
num_iter

Number of iterations.
num_samples

Number of sample points on which to build the model.
threshold

Threshold used to determine inlier points.
model_size

Acceptable model size.
max_slope

Maximum planar slope.
classify

Classify points as ground (2) or off-ground (1).
last_returns

Only include last- and only-return points.
wd

Changes the working directory.
verbose_mode

Sets verbose mode. If verbose mode is False, tools will not print output messages.
compress_rasters

Sets the flag used by WhiteboxTools to determine whether to use compression for output rasters.

Value

Returns the tool text outputs.

Contents
